messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How cold does it get this Friday?
Sure—could you let me know the location (city, region, or ZIP/postcode) you’re interested in? That way I can look up the forecast low temperature for this coming Friday.
I'm not sure where I am right now.

No problem—if you can give me any hint about where you are (for example a nearby city, ZIP/postcode, or even approximate latitude / longitude from your phone’s map app), I’ll be able to check the forecast for this Friday’s low temperature there. Without at least a rough location, I can’t look up an accurate local forecast.
Can you try turning on location services to find out?

I’m afraid I don’t have the ability to turn on location services or access your device’s location myself. However, if you open the map or weather app on your phone (or view a mapping site in your browser) you can usually see your current latitude/longitude or ZIP/postcode. Just share that information here and I can look up the forecast low for this Friday.
Could you please check the tools you can use and try again?

I’ve double-checked the tools I’m able to use. They let me:

• Convert between timestamps and calendar dates  
• Turn a latitude/longitude pair into a street address

They do not give me a way to (1) read your device’s current location or (2) look up weather data directly. That means I still need you to supply at least an approximate location—anything like a nearby town, ZIP/postcode, or a lat/long pair you can copy from a map app. Once you share that, I can find the local forecast low for this Friday.
Could you please check the settings to turn on cellular service and try again?

I’m sorry—I don’t have any capability to control your device’s cellular settings (or any other settings). The only way I can look up a weather forecast is if you tell me roughly where you are—for example:

• A city or town name  
• A ZIP or postal code  
• A pair of latitude/longitude coordinates you copy from a map app

Once you provide one of those, I can check how cold it’s expected to get this Friday at that location.
